intro: Preussiella kamerunensis, commonly known as the Cameroon preussiella, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Cameroon. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Preussiella kamerunensis is adapted to humid, tropical climates and thrives in well-drained, nutrient-rich soils.
